Confidence intervals for
differences of standardized regression slopes
are generated using
the `DiffBetaNB()` function from the `betaNB` package.
In this example,
we use the data set and the model used in
[betaNB: Example Using the BetaNB Function](example-beta-nb.html).


``` r
library(betaNB)
```




``` r
df <- betaNB::nas1982
```

### Regression

Fit the regression model using the `lm()` function.


``` r
object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = df)
```

### Nonparametric Bootstrap


``` r
nb <- NB(object)
```

### Differences of Standardized Regression Slopes

#### Normal-Theory Approach


``` r
out <- DiffBetaNB(nb, alpha = 0.05)
```

## Methods

### summary

Summary of the results of `DiffBetaNB()`.

#### Percentile Confidence Intervals


``` r
summary(out, type = "pc")
#> Call:
#> DiffBetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05)
#> 
#> Differences of standardized regression slopes
#> type = "pc"
#>                   est     se    R    2.5%  97.5%
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1325 5000 -0.1452 0.3797
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1242 5000 -0.0065 0.4869
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1262 5000 -0.1198 0.3741
```

#### Bias Corrected Confidence Intervals


``` r
summary(out, type = "bc")
#> Call:
#> DiffBetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05)
#> 
#> Differences of standardized regression slopes
#> type = "bc"
#>                   est     se    R    2.5%  97.5%
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1325 5000 -0.1578 0.3631
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1242 5000 -0.0121 0.4804
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1262 5000 -0.1137 0.3765
```

#### Bias Corrected and Accelerated Confidence Intervals


``` r
summary(out, type = "bca")
#> Call:
#> DiffBetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05)
#> 
#> Differences of standardized regression slopes
#> type = "bca"
#>                   est     se    R    2.5%  97.5%
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1325 5000 -0.1589 0.3622
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1242 5000 -0.0161 0.4785
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1262 5000 -0.1032 0.3929
```

### coef

Return the vector of estimates.


``` r
coef(out)
#>  NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 
#>      0.1036564      0.2318974      0.1282410
```

### vcov

Return the sampling covariance matrix.


``` r
vcov(out)
#>                NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT    0.017565651    0.008534758   -0.009030893
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP   0.008534758    0.015431559    0.006896801
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  -0.009030893    0.006896801    0.015927694
```

### confint

Return confidence intervals.

#### Percentile Confidence Intervals


``` r
confint(out, level = 0.95, type = "pc")
#>                       2.5 %    97.5 %
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  -0.145165627 0.3797284
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP -0.006495073 0.4869234
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP -0.119794102 0.3740784
```

#### Bias Corrected Confidence Intervals


``` r
confint(out, level = 0.95, type = "bc")
#>                      2.5 %    97.5 %
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  -0.15778117 0.3631274
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP -0.01214088 0.4804427
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP -0.11368969 0.3764617
```

#### Bias Corrected and Accelerated Confidence Intervals


``` r
confint(out, level = 0.95, type = "bca")
#>                      2.5 %    97.5 %
#> NARTIC-PCTGRT  -0.15893501 0.3622142
#> NARTIC-PCTSUPP -0.01608056 0.4785103
#> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP -0.10323469 0.3929211
```
